intro: Chrysocyathus cylleneus, commonly known as the golden cup coral, is a unique marine organism belonging to the order Sphenoporida. It is characterized by its intricate, branching structure composed of calcareous skeletal elements. This coral species is typically found in shallow, warm coastal waters where it forms colonies. Its coloration ranges from yellow to orange, giving it its common name. The organism plays a role in reef ecosystems by providing habitat for various marine species.
